New Records: India won by 68 runs, the largest margin of victory in a T20 World Cup semi-final
Key Match Events: Axar Patel took 3 wickets for 23 runs in 3 overs
Kuldeep Yadav took 3 wickets for 19 runs in 4 overs
Jonny Bairstow was bowled by Axar Patel for 0
Moeen Ali was bowled by Axar Patel for 0
Pre-Game Insights: England planned to shut out half of the outfield to India but they weren't always successful
Rohit Sharma was scoring at a strike rate of 133 with shots he was not at all in control of
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma accepted that risk is a part of T20 cricket and there's no point being averse to it
Axar Patel was the game-changer, taking 3 wickets for 23 runs in 3 overs
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was slow and the bounce was low, runs square and behind the wicket came at a premium
India's spin-bowling allrounders had a hand to play in getting them to 171
Kuldeep Yadav redeemed himself after being taken down hard in the 2019 ODI World Cup
Others: The match was played at Providence, Guyana
The match was a semi-final of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024
